PLUGIN.GROUPBY.DESCRIPTION: grouping of output data by ... as context
PLUGIN.CLOUDMETADATA.DESCRIPTION: determines cpu metrics by given vendor and instance type
PLUGIN.COEFFICIENT.DESCRIPTION: multiplies selected input by given coefficient
PLUGIN.CSVEXPORT.DESCRIPTION: outputs csv file on disk, containing values depending on given headers
PLUGIN.EMEM.DESCRIPTION: multiples the amount of memory being used by a energy-per-gb (memory/energy = (('memory/utilization'/100) * 'memory/capacity') * mem-energy)
PLUGIN.ENET.DESCRIPTION: multiplies the amount of data transferred (GB) by a coefficient (kWh/GB)  (network/energy = (data-in + data-out) * energy-per-gb)
PLUGIN.MOCKOBSERVATIONS.DESCRIPTION: generates observations for mocking purposes into a new yaml file
PLUGIN.SCI.DESCRIPTION: returns the amount of carbon emitted per functional unit (sci = carbon-operational + carbon-embodied / functional unit)
PLUGIN.SCIE.DESCRIPTION: sums up the contributions to a component's energy use (energy = 'cpu/energy' + 'network/energy' + 'memory/energy')
PLUGIN.SCIM.DESCRIPTION: calculates the amount of embodied carbon, emitted during the manufacture and eventual disposal of a component
PLUGIN.SCIO.DESCRIPTION: calculates the amount of operational carbon, generated by a component while it is in use (carbon-operational = energy * grid-intensity)
PLUGIN.SHELL.DESCRIPTION: executing shell commands, enables execution of plugins written in other programming languages
PLUGIN.TDPFINDER.DESCRIPTION: looks up thermal design power (TDP) of a given processor in a model datasets
PLUGIN.AZUREIMPORTER.DESCRIPTION: outputs metrics from the given vm and resource group in your Azure environment. Be aware you need to set up env variables to use this plugin (AZURE_TENANT_ID, AZURE_CLIENT_ID, AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET)
PLUGIN.BOAVIZTACPUOUTPUT.DESCRIPTION: uses the Boavitza API to calculate energy and embodied carbon with an environmental impact calculator
PLUGIN.BOAVIZTACLOUDOUTPUT.DESCRIPTION: uses the Boavitza API to calculate the energy usage and embodied carbon with an environmental impact calculator
PLUGIN.CLOUDCARBONFOOTPRINT.DESCRIPTION: calculates carbon footprint by given cpu utilization and cloud specifications
PLUGIN.CO2JS.DESCRIPTION: calculates the carbon emissions of a website
PLUGIN.TEADSAWS.DESCRIPTION: estimates energy usage of AWS instances by generating a power curve
PLUGIN.TEADSCURVE.DESCRIPTION: estimates CPU usages across varying types by generating a power curve
PLUGIN.WATTTIMEGRIDEMISSIONS.DESCRIPTION: uses an API to access real-time grid data. Be aware the set up of env variables (WATT_TIME_USERNAME, WATT_TIME_PASSWORD) is required to use this plugin.

PIPELINE_DIALOG.TITLE: Ihre Plugin Pipeline
PIPELINE_DIALOG.HINT_1: Hinweis: Die kursiven Eingabe Parameter werden durch Ausgaben von vorherigen Plugins in der Pipeline definiert.
PIPELINE_DIALOG.HINT_2: Hinweis: Falls Eingabe oder Ausgabe Attribute in <> Klammern angezeigt werden, müssen Sie noch dessen Namen konfigurieren.

TERMINAL_INSTRUCTION_DIALOG.EXPLAINATION: Folgen Sie diese Anweisungen um das Impact Framework zu nutzen.
TERMINAL_INSTRUCTION_DIALOG.STEP2: 2. Runterladen des Manifests und Ausführen des folgenden Befehls

INFO_DIALOG.EXPLAINATION: Dieses Werkzeug ist Teil des jährlichen Hackathons der Green Software Foundation, welches sich auf das Impact Framework (IF) fokussiert
INFO_DIALOG.EXPLAINATION2: Das Werkzeug unterstützt nicht nur Benutzer/innen ihre eigenen Manifest Dateien zu kreieren, welches als Eingabe des IF genutzt werden, sondern bietet auch eine Visualisierung der Ausgabe vom IF an.
INFO_DIALOG.EXPLAINATION3: Der Code ist öffentlich zugänglich auf

START_SCREEN.INTRO: Ich bin Manifest Wizard und ich bin hier um Sie auf Ihren Weg zur grünen Software zu unterstützen.
START_SCREEN.INTRO_2: Mithilfe des Impact Frameworks (IF) werden Ihre gesammelten Metriken in Umweltdaten transformiert.
